reviews.review_msg: I totally forgot to rate Jenny. I attended her Arch 332 class last year. She's an engaging professor who's clearly interested and engaged in her field of study. Also....total babe.
Great Prof, very helpful, funny and makes the lectures interesting. Recommended class for arch majors and non-majors. Textbooks good for reference
great class, broad topics, interesting slides and lectures.

Great prof, always accessible to students and really nice. Humorous in lecture. Knows his stuff. Quizzes not based on readings and textbook not required. Very fair class and TA was good too. David Maxwell is awesome
Absolutely wonderful!  He knew I was working hard, so he treated me with a lot of respect.  Cute, charming, and intelligent....I could not ask for more.

I took 131 with Dennis and loved the class and him so much that I could't wait to take this special topics class. However it was unfortunately not a very good class. He was quite disorganized and his exams were very difficult. He marked hard on the essay as well. I'd recommend him for Arch 131 but I do not think he organized this class very well.

Good teacher overall, but tends to go overtime (not in a good way).His lectures seemed 'dry',I just  couldn't process the information he was trying to teach; lectures became a little overwhelming.Tried paying attention,but only thing that brought me back to focus was probably when you heard ppl laugh at his jokes yet not 'interesting' information.

Assigns a LOT of readings, and it's essential that you attend classes because his lecture slides are only pictures, and you need to take your own notes. The prof himself is really great, he's a really good teacher and knows his material. Cares about how you do in the class.

Tons of reading and work for this class-not worth it at all. Theres a 15 pg term paper, and a take home final with 4 essay questions, which you were expected to write 4-6pgs each on! Way too much material, doesn't take into consideration students not familiar with concepts. Very helpful, but brutal. Wants ppl to do well, but doesnt really succeed
really hard class, need to read alot
